There isn't much evidence that it is doing all that much long-term damage—no more than alcohol use anyway

A National Crime Survey for England and Wales, 5.4 per cent of 16 to 24 year-olds admitted taking the class A drug over the past 12 months – a 40 per cent increase from 2003-2004.

Channel 4s drugs live program the trial could "pave the way to further research into potential therapeutic uses of MDMA, such as in the treatment of PTSD [post-traumatic stress disorder]
